artist: Artist: Peter de Jode; Artist: After Maarten de Vos
creditline: Gift of funds from Barbara S. Longfellow
description: couple wearing rather plain garments, with woman at left standing behind a table, holding a bucket of fish with her PL hand; flat tray-like basket of fish on table, with long, thin fish on table in LRC; man at right seated on edge of a boat; sea scene behind couple with fishermen on boats and on shore pulling in nets and filling barrels; tower with smoke in ULC; text at bottom below image
inscription:
Inscription and Stamp

at top edge left of center, in the print: [PHLEGMATICVS]; URC, in the print: [2]; along bottom edge, printed: [Martin Vossi, figurabat  Pettrus Jodoe, incidebat  Crispian, Passe, excudebat.]
markings: on back, LLC, stamped in black: monogram
provenance: Possibly Gaston de Ramaix (Belgium, 1878-1937, see Lugt 4099). Probably Henri Godts, Brussels, March 14, 2014, lot 46; [Nicolaas Teeuwisse, Berlin, cat. XV, p. 18-21, no. 6, illus.]
text:
This couple has the calm patience required for the tedious work of fishing and mending nets. They embody the phlegmatic temperament, the personality trait governed by phlegm. The obvious association with water suggests that these people go with the flow.

This plate belongs to a series of four engravings designed by Maarten de Vos, the most important painter in late 16th-century Antwerp, and executed by the highly skilled Flemish engraver Pieter d Jode I.
title: Phlegmatic
